qas.question: What group rioted at the textile factories?
How many people died in the textile factory riots?
How many posts did the Muslim Brotherhood get in Naguib's cabinet?
What was Nasser's position on executing the rioter's leaders?

context: Preceding the reform law, in August 1952, <a0_0>communist<a0_0/>-led riots broke out at textile factories in Kafr el-Dawwar, leading to a clash with the army that left <a1_0>nine<a1_0/> people dead. While most of the RCC insisted on executing the riot's two ringleaders, Nasser <a4_0>opposed<a4_0/> this. Nonetheless, the sentences were carried out. The <a2_0>Muslim Brotherhood<a2_0/> supported the RCC, and after Naguib's assumption of power, demanded four ministerial portfolios in the new cabinet. Nasser turned down their demands and instead hoped to co-opt the Brotherhood by giving <a3_0>two<a3_0/> of its members, who were willing to serve officially as independents, minor ministerial posts.
